In a span of 24 hours this past week, Elon Musk made three big bets with three different companies together, showing his pension to plow ahead despite sizable risks. Between Wednesday and Thursday evenings, he stripped celebrities, journalists, and other high-profile users their free legacy verification on Twitter, risking a VIP revolt on the social media platform. He promised that the electric car maker, Tesla, would chase sales volume at the expense of profitability, and he launched SpaceX first of its giant space rocket, which exploded on its the way to the heavens. In an era when risk management is a standard part of C-suite calculations, Ms. Musk has made his career and fortune, tolerating the kinds of bets that would strike panic in many corporate soldiers. Yet these gambles come as the 51-year-old billionaire enters the stage of his entrepreneurial career when big stumbles could end up overshadowing previous triumphs and undoing what he has built. Today's SpaceX, his rocket company, and Tesla, the electric car maker, grew out of near-misses dating back roughly 20 years ago. Mr. Musk said many times that he initially gave those ventures each a 10% chance of success. He put his personal fortune into them anyway. In doing so, he weathered failed rocket launches and avoided close calls with bankruptcies. When things have looked most bleak…

“If the odds are probably in your favor, you should make as many decisions as possible within bounds of what is executable," Mr. Musk said in a few years ago. This is likely being a house in Vegas. Probability is the most powerful force in the universe, which is why the house always wins. Buy the house. Be the house! In 2018, for example, when Tesla's cash was running low and car productions was slowed because of a mistake in over-automating his factory, Mr. Musk green-lighted an unprecedented idea to build cars under a tent outside the factory so that the company could move faster in remaking its assembly line and churn out the vehicles needed to generate needed revenues. Within the year, Tesla was printing a quarterly profit.

Brazil's Congress is poised to vote on contentious legislation to curb the spread of fake news, which has drawn opposition from Google and other tech groups facing tougher laws governing their content globally. Parliament is expecting the coming week to vote on the measure being pushed through as speed by the government led by President Lula. It aims to tackle the spread of misinformation, but critics decry it as draconian, rushed and open to abuse by special interests. The law would impose strict requirements on how tech companies deal with illegal and other damaging content, as well as punishment for groups that spread falsehoods at scale using robots or artificial intelligence. It has drawn a sharp backlash from the diverse correlation, including the lobby group for tech companies such as Google and Meta, free speech advocates and members of the far right. They variously argue that the bill may lead to censorship and is being rushed through. “Hasty legislation can make the internet work worse, restrict fundamental rights and create mechanisms to put legitimate speech and freedom of expression at risk,” said Marcelo Lassada of Google Brazil in an online post. The shift in Brazil, one of the most…one of the world's biggest social media markets with about 165 million users according to the data company Statistica, comes as digital platforms face new laws governing their content globally, with requests by more authoritarian governments presenting regulatory dilemma. The 31st Marine unit is meant to be a rapid response force designed for quick deployment to handle crisis anywhere in the Asia Pacific region.

For pilots flying over rural America, a string of red lights flashing along the horizon is a warning that there might be a wind farm ahead.
But for many residents on the ground, the lights are an eyesore that has ruined their view of the nightly sky and disrupted the picolic stillness that define their countries…counties
Imagine red blinking stoplights every night, all night long and not in sync.
Kansas and Colorado recently passed laws to limit the flashing lights by turning them only when the aircraft are approaching.
North Dakota approved a similar measure in 2017. A Washington state bill requiring light-mitigating technology was passed by lawmakers but hasn't been yet signed by the governor.

Aircraft detection technology approved by the Federal Aviation Administration has been on the market for a half dozen years. The systems are estimated to cost 1 million to 2 million to install with additional operating expenses each year.

Wind energy projects in the US largely concentrated in a high wind speed corridor stretching from North Dakota into West Texas have been slow to adopt the mitigation solutions. None of the more than 40 wind farms in Kansas, one of the top states for wind energy producing, use system that light up only when aircraft are near.
"When they are not forced to spend the money, why would they?" he said.
The new law comes as Federal Inflation Reduction Act funding is spurring investment in renewable energy projects.

The Federal Aviation Administration requires that wind turbines be painted a light color and have red lights on top. First Republic rescue fails to arrest a slide in U.S. regional bank shares. The rescue of First Republic this week has failed to arrest a sell-off in regional bank shares, which plunged on Tuesday afternoon as investors digested JPMorgan's takeover of the troubled California lender. Trading in PacWest, seen as one of the weakest of the mid-sized regional banks, was briefed out for volatility and was down 28% for late afternoon in New York. The fall put PacWest on course for the worst day that it could find since March 10, when Silicon Valley Bank collapsed, keep pressure on the entire sector. Western Alliance was down more than 15%. Both banks have drawn scrutiny because of their similarities of to SVB and First Republic, which were taken over by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation after they suffered huge deposit outflows and large paper losses on long-dated assets. JPMorgan bought First Republic's deposit and most of its asset on Monday. The shareholders were entirely wiped out. “They are going from weakest bank to the weakest bank. And it's not just the short sellers, but it's their customers as well as…as we're asking if their deposits are safe,” said Chris Welding, chair of Welding Global Advisors. The market is focusing on the weakest things and looking for banks that are vulnerable. The KBW index of regional banks stocks slide more than 5%. Utah-based Zion Bancorp was the biggest falter on the SP500 index, dropping 12%.

The Biden administration on Thursday will begin denying asylum to migrants who arrive at the U.S.-Mexico border without first applying online or seeking protection in a country they path through.
It marks a fundamental shift in migration policy at the U.S. readies the end of a key...restriction.
Asylum seekers have been showing up at the border in huge numbers in anticipation of this week's end of the use of a restriction known as Title 42.
Asylum seekers have been showing up at the border and that rule has allowed the government to quickly expel migrants to Mexico.
The rule announced Wednesday is a part of new measures mean to crack down on illegal border crossings while creating new legal pathways.
Families who cross the border will face curfews and monitoring. The head of household will wear an ankle bracelet and their cases are heard within 30 days.
But there's also a plan to open 100 regional migration hubs across the Western Hemisphere and granting humanitarian parole to 30,000 people a month to enter the country from four countries.

U.S. officials have detailed steps they've taken, including increasing deportation flights, as they prepare for what many are expecting to be a substantial increase in migrants at the U.S.-Mexico border.
Our plan will deliver results, but it will take time for those results to be fully realized. Homeland Security Secretary warned.
Many migrants, spurred by concerns that it may soon become harder to stay in the US, were trying to cross before Title 42 expires and the new rule takes effect at the end of the day Thursday.

Yeah the activity I relished most during my free time when I was young was reading. I was fortunate to have a small library near my house which became my sanctuary. My brother and I would go there at least once a week carrying home armloads of books that we'd devour over the coming days. Our reading interests were diverse ranging from fantasy and adventure novels to books on science, history and biographies of inspiring individuals. We were insatiable and the library's vast collection never disappointed us. Sometimes we'd get so engrossed in our books that we'd spend entire afternoons reading in the library itself, losing track...track of time amidst the stacks. I immensely enjoyed these...this activity for several reasons. First, reading transported me to different worlds, allowed me to experience diverse perspectives and...and ignited my imagination. I found this both entertaining and intellectually stimulating. Secondly, it was a shared experience with my brother and our discussions about the books we read brought us closer. The landscape of activities available for young people has undeniably undergone substantial transformation over the past two decades, with advancements in technology, globalization, and societal attitude playing significant roles in this evolution. Overall, the opportunities for engagement in entertainment and education available to young people today are arguably more diverse and abundant than they were 20 years ago. Well firstly, the digital revolution has significantly expanded the range of activities available for young people. The advent of the internet and…and subsequent explosion of digital technologies has led to a proliferation of online activities that were simply not possible 20 years ago. Today…today's youth can engage in an array of online gaming experiences, participate in various social media platforms, enroll in e-learning courses, develop skills through online tutorials, collaborate on digital projects, and much more. Furthermore, the ubiquity of smartphones has enabled young people from…to access information, communicate, and engage in activities anywhere…anytime, anywhere. This has not only made a broader range of activities accessible but also created new ones, for instance, augmented reality games like Pokemon Go and…or the trend of vlogging. Secondly, globalization and advancement in transport or communication technologies has…have made international travel more accessible, allowing young people to engage in activities like study abroad programs, international volunteer work, and youth exchange programs. In the sphere of education and skill development, there are more opportunities than ever before. From coding camps, makerspaces, entrepreneurship programs, to art workshops, there is a wealth of resources available for young people to explore their interests and talents, and these are continuously expanding. Moreover, societal attitudes towards youth activities have also evolved. There is a growing recognition of the importance of youth engagement in civic activities, leading to more opportunities for young people to get involved in community service, activism, and leadership roles. Likewise, the acceptance and…and encouragement of diverse interests and identities have led to a broader range of clubs and organizations that cater to different passions and backgrounds. That said, it’s crucial to note that access to these growing opportunities is not equally distributed. Factors such as socioeconomic status, geographical location, and internet access can significantly impact the range of activities accessible to young people. In conclusion, the last 20 years have seen a significant increase in diversification in the activities available to young people. This is largely driven by technology…technological advancements, globalization, and shiftments in societal attitudes. However…however, efforts should continue to ensure that all young people, regardless of their circumstances, can benefit from the growing range of opportunities for engagement, growth, and development.

In countries like the United States, for example, achieving a work-life balance can be quite challenging. Long working hours, minimal vacation time, and the blurring lines between work and personal life due to the rise of remote work can impede work-life balance. A report by the OECD showed that the United States ranked 30 out of 38 countries in terms work-life balance as of 2020. On the other hand, countries like Denmark, Finland, and the Netherland often rank high on the work-life balance indices, thanks to supportive labor laws, a culture that value leisure and family time, and widespread flexible working practices. However, even in countries with favorable conditions, achieving work-life balance can still be challenging due to factors such as personal work habits, the nature of one's jobs, or societal expectations. For instance, individuals in high-stress professions or those who face societal or...or internal pressure to prioritize work over personal life might struggle with work-life balance, regardless of supportive policies or norms. Moreover, work-life balance doesn't solely depend on working hours. It also encompasses the ability to enjoy quality leisure time and maintain mental and physical health. Over… overwork, stress and burnout can occur even in flexible working conditions if individuals don't manage their workloads or stress levels effectively, or if their leisure time is not truly restorative. In conclusion, while certain environments, policies, and practices can facilitate work-life balance, whether most people can achieve this balance is nuanced and depends on a myriad of factors. Achieving work-life balance is a multifaceted issue requiring a combination of supportive policies, workplace culture…culture change, and individual strategies for managing work and personal life demands. Given the complexity and individuality of this issue, it's challenging to make a broad generalization about the ability of most people to achieve work-life balance in any given country.

For adults, the amount of leisure time often depends on their employment status, working hours, and personal responsibilities. Many adults, particularly those working full-time or juggling multiple jobs, may find their leisure time squeezed. This issue is particularly pronounced in countries with longer working hours and less supportive work-life balance policies. Also, adults with considerable family responsibilities, such as caring for children or elderly relatives, may have less leisure time. Moreover, with the rise of remote work and technology use, the boundaries between work and leisure have blurred for many people. It can be challenging to switch off from work, with emails, calls, and messages can be accessed at all times, leading to the encroachment of work into leisure time. For children, school, homework, and extracurricular activities can take up a significant portion of their day. Some argue that children today face more academic pressure and structured activities than previous generations, potentially reducing their unstructured leisure time. Additionally, the increased use of technology, particularly screen time, has changed the nature of children's leisure activities, raising concerns about physical health and…and social skills. However, it is important to note that not all work or school time is devoid of enjoyment, and not all leisure time is necessarily relaxing or fulfilling. The quality of leisure time matters as much as, if not more than, the quantity. Leisure activities that provide relaxation, enjoyment, and opportunities for personal growth and…and social connections contribute more to overall well-being. Societal trends suggest that the struggle to find sufficient time for quality leisure activities is common…is a common challenge. To address this, individuals and families can consider strategies such as setting boundaries for work time, prioritizing leisure activities that provide the most fulfillment, and striving for efficiency in necessary but time-consuming activities. In conclusion, whether adults or children have enough time for leisure activities nowadays is dependent on a myriad of factors, with many individuals and families facing challenges in this regard. Balancing work or school personal responsibilities and leisure time is a complex task that require ongoing attention and adaptability. Alright.

Well, the famous person that I'm interested in is Jack Ma, a Chinese entrepreneur and philanthropist. He's the founder of Alibaba Group, one of the world's largest e-commerce companies. I first learned about Jack Ma when I was studying business in college. He was often mentioned as a prominent figure in the Chinese tech industry. And I became curious about his story and how he had achieved such remarkable success. Before he became famous, Jack Ma struggled with setbacks and rejections. He was rejected from many jobs and was even turned down by KFC when they opened up their first restaurant in China. Eventually he founded Alibaba Group in 1999, I believe, which started out as a...as an online marketplace connecting Chinese manufacturers with oversea buyers. What interests me most about Jack Ma is his perseverance and his commitment to social responsibility. He has faced many obstacles in his career, but has always maintained a positive attitude and willingness to learn from his mistakes. Additionally, he has used his wealth and influence to give back to society, supporting causes such as environmental protection and education. So in conclusion, I think Jack Ma is an inspiring figure who has made a significant impact on the Chinese tech industry and beyond. His story shows that with hard work, perseverance and willingness to take risks, anyone can achieve great things. I'm interested in him for his vision, his business...his his business acumen and his passion, commitment to making the world a better place.

One of the most meaningful gifts I have ever received was a hand-made quilt from my grandma. The quilt is made up of different patches of fabric, each with a unique pattern and color. My grandma spent months working on it, stitching each piece of fabric together with care and attention to detail. I received the quilt as a gift on my 18th birthday. My grandma surprised me with it during a family gathering, and I was overwhelmed with gratitude and emotion. I had always admired my grandma's quilting skills, and having a piece of her handiwork meant a lot of...lot to me. After I received the quilt, I displayed it proudly in my bedroom for several months. Whenever I looked at it, I was reminded of my grandma's generosity and her love for me. The quilt also became a symbol of my family's history and traditions, as many of the patches were made from old clothes and fabrics that have been passed down from generation to generation. Over the years, I have continued to cherish the quilt. Whenever I feel homesick or miss my family, I wrap myself up in it and feel the sense of comfort and connection that it brings. Overall, this gift holds a special place in my heart because it represents my family's love, perseverance, and creativity. It is a reminder of the bonds that tie us together and the importance of taking time to create things that are meaningful and lasting.
Yes, of course. I've told the story to every family member and some of my friends as well.

The most recent movie I watched that left me feeling disappointed was Wonder Woman 1984. As a fan of the original Wonder Woman movie, I was excited to see this sequel and the new storyline that he promised. The movie follows Diana Prince, also known as Wonder Woman, as the navigate's life in the 1980s. The story revolves around a magical object that grants wishes which leads to chaos and destruction. While the premise sounded interesting, the execution fell short for me. I decided to watch this movie as I enjoyed the first one and was interested in seeing how the filmmakers would take the character in a future action. However, I was disappointed by the uneven pacing, lack luster action scenes, and at times cheesy dialogue. Moreover, I felt that the plot was convoluted and failed to establish clear stakes or consequences. This brought the strong performances of the cast, especially Gail Gadot's portrayal of Wonder Woman. There were too many unexplained and unconvincing plot points that left me feeling confused and underwhelmed. In conclusion, while I was excited to watch Wonder Woman 1984, I automatically left the movie feeling disappointed. The lackluster execution of the plot and uneven pacing left me unenthused despite the strong performances of the cast.

Absolutely. Children should be taught the value of help others from young ages. Teaching children to help others cultivate empathy, compassion, and a sense of social responsibility. When children learn to assist others, it develops important life skills such as cooperation, teamwork, and problem solving.
Children are motivated to help each other at school for several reason. First, a sense of camaraderie and belonging foster a supportive environment where children naturally wants to help their peers.

Students should definitely engages in community services for several compelling reason. First, community services helps students develop a sense of social responsibilities and empathies towards other. By actively participating in service activities, students becomes aware of societal issue and the challenge faced by underprivileged community.
